	boundary="=====================_14611218==_.ALT"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] DEA Chief Wanted to Attend Rave

--=====================_14611218==_.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed


Even DEA chief had brush with club drug scene
August 23, 2001
BY FRANK MAIN CRIME REPORTER
He's the head of the U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration.
But like any other parent, Asa Hutchinson has the same struggles over how 
to react to the dangers of drugs.
Hutchinson, tapped in June to run the DEA, was in Oak Brook on Wednesday to 
address a conference on Ecstasy and other club drugs, an increasing problem 
for Chicago and the suburbs. He wove a personal tale of why he thinks DEA 
needs to do more to educate parents about the risks of club drugs.
After he was appointed to run DEA, Hutchinson said, one of his sons asked 
for permission to go to a "rave," a type of dance party.
"He said, 'Dad, I know there's always drugs out there, but you know I just 
want to hear the music,' " Hutchinson told a group of about 300 federal, 
state and local law enforcement officials.
Hutchinson said he told his son it wasn't a good idea, but his son 
responded: "If you have any doubt, why don't you go with me?"
Hutchinson agreed. His son was so proud his dad was going to the dance that 
he posted the information on a rave Web site. The DEA and other law 
enforcement agencies monitor such sites to track raves because club drug 
sales are common there.
"Pretty soon I had a call from Washington--the DEA. They said, 'Where are 
you going tonight?' They said, 'You can't go to that rave.' "
"I said, 'I have a son who's ready to go, and you better have a mighty good 
reason,' " Hutchinson said.
The DEA responded that agents planned to arrest the promoter of the rave 
for allegedly trafficking in Ecstasy, and Hutchinson decided to stay home.
Indeed, the promoter was arrested and about two weeks later, while out on 
bail, threw another rave in a Little Rock, Ark., warehouse, where a teenage 
boy died with club drugs in his system, Hutchinson said.
"The point of my story," Hutchinson told the group, "is how difficult it is 
to get the right information and make the right decisions." He added that 
"we do not do enough to help parents."
After Hutchinson's speech, Chicago police Supt. Terry Hillard and Cook 
County Sheriff Michael Sheahan agreed to launch a campaign to educate 
school superintendents and principals about club drugs, which they 
described as a growing scourge for teenagers and young adults in the region.
"This is something that kids think is safe to take," Sheahan said. "But I 
know of at least three cases in which kids died thinking they were taking a 
safe drug."
Beyond education, authorities think a new law taking effect in January will 
help curb club drug sales. A conviction for possessing 15 Ecstasy pills 
could result in a prison sentence of at least six years under the new 
legislation.
Club drugs have become a pervasive problem in DuPage County, and are 
flowing into suburban Cook County and the city of Chicago, officials said. 
In Chicago, police have seized more than 200,000 Ecstasy tablets so far 
this year, Hillard said.
"It's going to be like crack cocaine and heroin," he said. "It's here to 
stay."

http://www.suntimes.com/output/news/cst-nws-dope23.html


"It is only with the heart that one can see rightly;  what is essential is 
invisible to the eye."
-Antoine de Saint-Exupery

"I'm astounded by people who want to "know" the universe when it's hard 
enough to find your way around Chinatown."
-Woody Allen

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re:DJ question


EXACTLY!  Sometimes a crowd needs a break to get into a deep groove.

chris

> 	The tempo of the record is not always inline with the energy of
> the record. You can have bumpin house that is way more energetic than
> really fast minimal techno. At time in the night you can actually get a
> dance floor going stonger by slowing down the tempo so the crowd can
> groove to the beat. 
> 
> 	And to those dj that do just bump up the tempo of the records
> through out their set thinking that this will increase the energy of the
> dance floor without thinking about the energy of the records themselves
> and putting together a set that flows-you need to think things through a
> bit more. Jungle Dj's that play records pitched up thinkin it's gonna get
> the crowd going and think it sounds better that way, just make me walk
> off the dance floor.
> 
> 	FASTER IS NOT BETTER.
> 
> 	josh
>

Subject: [sfraves] Edmonton looks at rave age of 16

--=====================_15808888==_.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Council to look at rave age of 16
Stiffer proposals dropped by council committee
Sarah O'Donnell and Darren Stewart, Journal Staff Writers
The Edmonton Journal
Cinderella can stay at the dance as long as she wants, provided she's at 
least 16.
Proposals to close raves and after-hours clubs by 3 a.m., and kick out 
youths under age 18 by midnight -- the so-called Cinderella clause -- have 
been axed by city council's executive committee.
Instead, all late-night dances will have to bar anyone under the age of 16.
Council will debate the plan Aug. 28.
Cathy Pope, 17, said she agrees with City Hall's decision though she 
doesn't go to many raves or after-hours clubs.
"It's no fun to go out and party with 12-year-olds," she said. "And people 
under 16 shouldn't be out that late anyways, not to mention all the 
exposure to drugs."
Jessica Robinson, who just turned 16 and goes to after-hours clubs, was 
glad councillors didn't make the age limit 18.
"I can see the 16-year age limit being fair. When you turn 16 you like to 
have somewhere to go without all those younger kids there."
Fernando Cartagena, 20, goes to raves and has visited after- hours clubs 
frequently over the past three years. He said City Hall is wrong to be 
concerned about raves.
"You look around here and you see a lot of underage kids drinking," he said 
while sitting in the bleachers at Edgefest at Telus Field on Wednesday.
"Sure there's drugs at raves but there's a lot more security and control. 
Here we've seen two fights already today and people are smoking marijuana 
and security just turns a blind eye."
He said the over-consumption of alcohol, which isn't served at raves and 
after-hours clubs, causes more problems.
"Raves are a lot more peaceful than a scene like this," he said.
Rave promoters and club owners like the new plan, but not those working or 
living next to the permanent clubs. Many have complained about noise, 
vandalism and loitering.
"To the property owners in and around the downtown core, I'm sorry," said 
Coun. Robert Noce, voting in favour of the less restrictive bylaw. "I don't 
have a solution that would satisfy everyone. Maybe there isn't one."
With good-neighbour clauses that will be conditions for all-night clubs to 
receive a business licences, the new bylaw is tough, Mayor Bill Smith said.
"As we sort through the whole process of licensing, I think the 
neighbourhood will understand there's some real controls."
The decision in favour of allowing all-night dancing for anyone 16 and 
older came after an afternoon of discussion that included comments from 15 
members of the public.
In the end, those in the rave community got exactly what they were hoping 
for, said Mike Peebles of Rave Safe and Oliver Friedmann, owner of Therapy, 
an after-hours club.
"I think some reasonableness broke out in there," Friedmann said after the 
meeting. "This is one of the most comprehensive bylaws in the country in 
terms of the permit requirements."
But Lillian Pushor, general manager of Alberta Suite Hotel, which is near a 
few clubs, said she still worried club owners wouldn't face any 
consequences if they contravene the bylaw.
"If at some point in time we get the bylaw officers in place, the resources 
they need to enforce the bylaws, then maybe this can work," she said. "We 
want to offer our guests who come into the city of Edmonton or our 
residents in the downtown area, a safe and peaceful place to be in the 
hours, especially between midnight and 7 a.m."
http://www.edmontonjournal.com/city/stories/010823/662872.html

"It is only with the heart that one can see rightly;  what is essential is 
invisible to the eye."
-Antoine de Saint-Exupery

"I'm astounded by people who want to "know" the universe when it's hard 
enough to find your way around Chinatown."
-Woody Allen

Subject: [sfraves] You CAN Do Something to Help Protect California's Wildlife!!!



>Reply-To: denlines@den.defenders.org
> "Defenders of Wildlife" <denlines@den.defenders.org> DEN Alert: Help Protect California's Wildlife DENlines@defenders.org (DEN California Activist)Date: Thu, 23 Aug 2001 11:50:09 -0400
>
>DEN Alert: 
>Stop the repeal of California's strongest wildlife protection law
>
>Developers and the timber, oil and agribusiness industries are 
>working to repeal California's strongest wildlife protection law  
>the Fully Protected Species statute. This law is crucial to the 
>survival and recovery of the 39 mammals, fish, birds, reptiles, and 
>amphibians on the Fully Protected Species list -- including the 
>southern sea otter, California condor, California least tern, 
>golden eagle, peregrine falcon, bighorn sheep, and salt marsh 
>harvest mouse. Now, the California State Senate is considering two 
>bills (AB 985 and AB 1561) to repeal this important law. 
>
>California's wide diversity of habitats supports an amazing variety 
>of creatures from California condors to sea otters, from blunt-nosed 
>leopard lizards to big horn sheep. These creatures are part of the 
>web of living things that makes California unique. And California 
>protects this wildlife with some of the strongest laws in the 
>nation. Please help maintain these vital wildlife protections by 
>expressing your opposition to these bills.
>
>WHAT YOU CAN DO: 
>
>Send a free fax to your state senator and ask him or her to vote 
>against any legislation that would weaken protection for Fully 
>Protected Species. The vote may come up as early as AUGUST 28, so 
>please send your fax TODAY. We encourage you to put the sample 
>letter below into your own words. Thanks for supporting California's 
>wildlife.
>
>
>
>INSTRUCTIONS TO RESPOND VIA THE WEB: 
>
>If you have access to the web, simply click on the link below which 
>will take you to the DEN Action Center web site:
>
>                        http://www.denaction.org 
>
>
>
>
>Sample Letter:
>
>Re: OPPOSE AB 985/AB 1561  Stop the Rollback of the Fully Protected 
>Species Statute
>
>Dear Senator:
>
>I am writing to ask you to oppose AB 985 and AB 1561, which seek to 
>repeal the Fully Protected Species statute, California's strongest 
>wildlife protection law.
>
>The Fully Protected Species statute prohibits the killing of a 
>fully protected species and the destruction of its habitat if this 
>would ultimately lead to its death or destruction  with no 
>exceptions.  This is significantly greater protection than that 
>afforded species that are listed under the California Endangered 
>Species Act or Natural Community Conservation Planning Act.
>
>Fully Protected Species status is crucial to the survival and 
>recovery of many species. I urge you to oppose any legislation that 
>would allow for Fully Protected Species to be killed without 
>significantly improving current endangered species laws.
>
>Sincerely,
>
>
>
>
>==================================================================== 
>To unsubscribe, send an e-mail to denlines@defenders.org and put the
>word UNSUBSCRIBE in the subject line. 
>==================================================================== 
>To subscribe, visit Defenders' website at http://www.defenders.org/den 
>or send an e-mail to denlines@defenders.org and put the word SUBSCRIBE 
>in the subject line.  
>==================================================================== 
>If your e-mail address has changed, send an e-mail to 
>changeaddress@defenders.org and put your new e-mail address in the 
>subject line. Make sure you put nothing in the subject line other 
>than your new e-mail address.
>==================================================================== 
>Defenders of Wildlife is a leading national conservation organization 
>recognized as one of the nation's most progressive advocates for 
>wildlife and its habitat and known for its effective leadership on 
>saving endangered species such as brown bears and gray wolves, Defenders 
>advocates new approaches to wildlife conservation that protect species 
>before they become endangered. Founded in 1947, Defenders is a nonprofit 
>501(c)(3)organization with more than 420,000 members and supporters.
>
>                       Defenders of Wildlife
>                  1101 14th Street, NW, Suite 1400
>                       Washington, DC 20005

Subject: RE: [sfraves] NRR: IE OR NETSCAPRE 6.0

I was speaking about windows, not necessarily all MS products.  I don't 
have any problem with DOS - it was quite stable.. win311 was just a simple 
gui that floated over dos.. Once I realized how shitty 311 was, I didn't 
use it, and kept using straight dos until 95 came out.  I've also tested 
developer and beta versions of the different winbloze.. the only difference 
between beta and gold is the quantity of bugs.  I have always used latest 
hardware, the newest drivers, and winbloze still can't keep up.  If XP 
doesn't allow full control over hardware, the way 98 does and 2000 and NT 
do not, I doubt it will spread all that quickly.  I'm also not to keen on 
the integration of browser and OS.  They should remain completely 
separate.  Linux isn't about hype.  It's free.  Anyone can develop for it, 
and all the secure internet servers are running a unix variant.  Yes, I'm 
daring you to say that IIS is secure.  Unix was written by Bell Labs in the 
late 70's, long before windows was conceptualized.  It's certainly not 
going anywhere.

sarilion

Office products are a lot like AOL.  They assume you're completely 
retarded, and if you try to do something specific, it won't let 
you.  That's not quality programming.

> >will see people claiming to have copies of Windows 1 and 2, but in reality

> >for everyday use.  So for being a first version it was pretty stable and I

> >3.11 the only problem is that people who had older hardware and unstable
> >Windows 3.11 setups wanted the upgrade to work miracles and fix all of their
> >problems and it didn't.  It wasn't designed to do that.  Windows 95b was
> >actually even more stable then Windows 95 or even 95a because it did not
> >support upgrades and had more drivers.  Windows 98 built upon the stability
> >of Windows 95, but added the integration of Windows and Internet Explorer
> >and there were problems with the upgrade so once again the uninformed blamed
> >the OS, not their hardware or setup.  Windows 98 Second Edition fixed a lot
> >of the stability problems with the IE 4 / Win Explorer merger and led way to
> >Windows ME which was basically created for the machine manufacturers so that
> >they could have better rollout tools and an easier way to add all of the
> >security and service pack and hot fix updates released by Microsoft over the
> >year since the release of Windows 98.  It also started using a new driver
> >model closer to that of Windows NT/2K.
> >
> >Windows XP will replace Windows 98/Me and it will happen very fast because
> >manufacturer's will begin to stop making windows 9x/Me drivers for their
> >hardware and once that is done, it usually signals the death knoll for the
> >operating system.  It's what happened to Windows 3.11 previously.

> >they have done, but I also believe that they are not nearly as incompetent
> >as the Linux'ers and Mac'ers wanna make them out to be.

Thanks kids for bringing me the beats that cured my head, I need them, even tony's porno house set, hehe, actually I probably needed that most of all.  Heh.

I rememeber looking around throughout the day and thinking how glad I am to know all these kids as my brothers and sisters and act like a goofy freak without any cares!  (sorry if I spilled on you, those damn cups, its sorta hard to keep whats in them, in them, hehe.)

I enjoyed being a "social butterfly" with all of you, and leave it to ASR to bring out only the best in what we all call HOUSE MUSIC.  I had to act like a little brat in order to catch a little of Joe Rice's set, but it was worth it, all the djs that I was able to catch brought me a little closer to the house, Tracy (omg), Orestes, and Joe, and I think I missed a couple djs do to being a total lagger (crisco, the one and only ;)

gee, I love my lil family, every single one of you :P

You guys should note the exact location of Nocturnal Wonderland.... its
actually technically in Needles, CA I believe. Its not a Lake Havasu proper.
Its at the "Lake Havasu Landing Resort" or something (check the website to
be sure of all of this). So if you are flying in to LV... you're probably
going to have to drive a decent distance and I can only guess that most
people in SF dont have a car waiting for them in LV, so you'd have to add
rental car prices and gas onto that.

Laurence

Claudia Pfister, a spokeswoman for a Berlin animal rights group, said that
she feared the event would lead to copycat art, such as, get ready for this:

Now this crazy bitch is just trying to get offended. She thinks that people
will see a pile of beef fall from a helicopter, and she's worried they're
going to drop their dog out of a window? For that to happen people not only
have to watch Austrian performance art, but they'd have to think their
window was a helicopter, and then forget that dogs are not cows. You might
as well worry that they're going to shave their balls and learn to fly.

Subject: RE: [sfraves] NRR: IE OR NETSCAPRE 6.0


divan@seas.upenn.edu wrote:

>Do you work for Microsoft's PR department or did you just copy all of that
>from Microsoft's website?

>With pretty much Microsoft product I have ever used, I have gone through
>these steps:

Right on Damien.  I went throught those same steps quite a lot myself.  Well,
that was before I decided to quit being played the fool and swear off that
filth that spews forth from seattle alltogether.

It suprises me to no end tho, that even here in the bay area that there are so
many people so anxious to suck up to gates and be one of his minions.  I'd
feel... well... dirty... whoreing myself out like that.

>The only exception to this rule has been IE for the Mac. It's not perfect,
>but in reality, Netscape just sucks so much,

You should try Omniweb.  It's really quite excellent and serves as my primary
webbrowser now.  It's faster, uses less memory, locks up less, and is less
buggy than IE.

See, IE is just a mediocre Carbon port of the existing explorer code.  Omniweb,
on the other hand, is a fully native Cocoa application, created by The Omni
Group.  Actually, it originated as a NeXT application, but Cocoa basicly IS all
of the NeXT frameworks... one of the BEST development environments the world's
seen.  They just dusted it off and made it look better to reintroduce them as
Cocoa.  That and Cocoa now supports Java as a native development language as
well as Objective C.  It has quite a history of stable, reliable, excellent
service.

Anyway, I HIGHLY recommend you give Omniweb a try.  The only drawback is that
it doesn't support some plugins.  So if you're on a site that uses the more
obnoxious ones, you might load IE just for that site.  Otherwise, Omniweb is my
primary browser now.

Oh, BTW... yours is one of the birthdays this weekend, along with Becca, yes? 
Happy Birthday!  You should go to Sound Aslyum... it's gonna be SWEET.  But
whatever you do, have fun.


cya,
john

Message-ID: <003001c12c32$cd5dfb80$b50456d1@sauoq>
From: "A. Nonymous" <snowhuoue@mindspring.com>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
References: <NFBBLOLNELECECNEIIFJIEAOCDAA.dapydork@yahoo.com><4.3.1.0.20010823100422.00b96968@qix.netcorps.com> <4.3.1.0.20010823152334.00ba5690@qix.netcorps.com>
Date: Thu, 23 Aug 2001 17:21:43 -0700
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Priority: 3
X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 5.00.2919.6700
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V5.00.2919.6700
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: IE OR NETSCAPRE 6.0

The web is TV II, the sequel. It sucks, so don't use either. If you can't
find it on a gopher server it isn't worth reading.

*smirk*

But, if you must (and you probably must) I'd say IE is better these days and
if you use Windows, you might as well use it. I never used to use Windows at
all, but the fscking winmodem in my laptop isn't supported by Linux (yes,
I've checked into linmodem.) Oh well... so much for my professional slogan,
"I don't do Windows."

I recently stopped using Netscrape 6 myself because it crashed all the time.
The mail reader really screwed up on occasion too.

I have to say that if you don't want to use IE because you prefer to boycott
MS, I support you wholeheartedly... but then you might as well get rid of
winblows too.

As far as browser extensions... I don't see anything wrong with them. IFRAME
is a fine tag, but I never include it in any HTML that *I* write. The onus
is on the web developer to disregard non-standard extensions. The browser
developers should feel free to extend their own browser at will. If a
particular extension is really useful, it will be picked up by other
browsers and eventually standardized. On the other hand, the browser
developers do have a duty to implement the relevant standards properly and
as completely as possible. I honestly don't know how IE measures up on that
score these days.




---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

bullshit. You CAN'T eat before you go out. That's the
dumbest thing to do. Because if you do, you're just
NOT going to stop. NO WAY. Even if you think you are
mentally strong, you are NOT. Because even if you
decide to just get a little snack, you're going to
forget once you open your cousin's fridge and see
gourmet delight, and then your ass will keep eating
and munching and eating and munching and eating till
your pants size jump 3 sizes and your body explodes,
and that's just gonna fuck up your digestive system
totally. How are you gonna go to the party, much less
dance if your ass can't even walk and move out the
door? And worse, what if you end up having to take a
fat shit at a party? That is ultimate grossness. And
what kind of people shit at parties anyway? The stupid
ones who just ate before going out!

And if some of you don't know why people have the
incredible urge to eat more than they should just
right before a party, then you're stupid too and
you're missing out.

FOOD - Know when to say when.

Date: Thu, 23 Aug 2001 21:09:43 -0700 (PDT)
From: Chris Erwin <tool_42@yahoo.com>
To: raver@sarilion.org
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: RE: [sfraves] NRR: IE OR NETSCAPRE 6.0

Ok, I just wanna say a couple things here..  First of all, 3.1, 95, and 98 are
all just guis floating over DOS, I used to have my 98 box set up with bootgui=0
and I could start and exit windows to and from DOS just like I could in 3.1. 
Second of all, the browser integration thing already happened, get over it.  In
98 watch what happens if you stop the program explorer, also try putting a URL
in windows explorer rather than iexplore, does the same shit.  Microsoft merely
called them different things to try and get around the integration anti-trust
crap..
Finally, the seperation of software and hardware levels NT/2k uses is called
the Hardware Abstraction Layer, or HAL, and it's a good thing, I've had my
win2k box up for months at a time, and I have a shitty USB CD-rw which would
crash it daily if it wasn't for HAL.(well, mostly cause I turn the thing off
and on without warning the PC, but it's got a mind of it's own, this whole USB
mess)

Luckily I figured out that the sony spressa USB CD-rws are just IDE cd-rws in
USB adapted boxes, and I took mine out of the box and put it in an ide slot, so
it no longer has an attitude..

Now, can we PLEASE go back to talking about raving on this rave list?

Date: Thu, 23 Aug 2001 15:31:01 -0700
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: Sarilion <raver@sarilion.org>
Subject: RE: [sfraves] NRR: IE OR NETSCAPRE 6.0
Message-Id: <4.3.1.0.20010823152334.00ba5690@qix.netcorps.com>

I was speaking about windows, not necessarily all MS products.  I don't 
have any problem with DOS - it was quite stable.. win311 was just a simple 
gui that floated over dos.. Once I realized how shitty 311 was, I didn't 
use it, and kept using straight dos until 95 came out.  I've also tested 
developer and beta versions of the different winbloze.. the only difference 
between beta and gold is the quantity of bugs.  I have always used latest 
hardware, the newest drivers, and winbloze still can't keep up.  If XP 
doesn't allow full control over hardware, the way 98 does and 2000 and NT 
do not, I doubt it will spread all that quickly.  I'm also not to keen on 
the integration of browser and OS.  They should remain completely 
separate.  Linux isn't about hype.  It's free.  Anyone can develop for it, 
and all the secure internet servers are running a unix variant.  Yes, I'm 
daring you to say that IIS is secure.  Unix was written by Bell Labs in the 
late 70's, long before windows was conceptualized.  It's certainly not 
going anywhere.

sarilion

Office products are a lot like AOL.  They assume you're completely 
retarded, and if you try to do something specific, it won't let 
you.  That's not quality programming.

# as my primary
# webbrowser now.  It's faster, uses less memory, locks up less,
# and is less
# buggy than IE.
#
# See, IE is just a mediocre Carbon port of the existing explorer
# code.  Omniweb,
# on the other hand, is a fully native Cocoa application, created
# by The Omni
# Group.  Actually, it originated as a NeXT application, but
# Cocoa basicly IS all
# of the NeXT frameworks... one of the BEST development
# environments the world's
# seen.  They just dusted it off and made it look better to
# reintroduce them as
# Cocoa.  That and Cocoa now supports Java as a native
# development language as
# well as Objective C.  It has quite a history of stable,
# reliable, excellent
# service.
#
# Anyway, I HIGHLY recommend you give Omniweb a try.  The only
# drawback is that
# it doesn't support some plugins.  So if you're on a site that
# uses the more
# obnoxious ones, you might load IE just for that site.
# Otherwise, Omniweb is my
# primary browser now.

# and is less
# buggy than IE.

# See, IE is just a mediocre Carbon port of the existing explorer
# code.  Omniweb,
# on the other hand, is a fully native Cocoa application, created
# by The Omni
# Group.  Actually, it originated as a NeXT application, but
# Cocoa basicly IS all
# of the NeXT frameworks... one of the BEST development
# environments the world's
# seen.  They just dusted it off and made it look better to
# reintroduce them as
# Cocoa.  That and Cocoa now supports Java as a native
# development language as
# well as Objective C.  It has quite a history of stable,
# reliable, excellent
# service.
#
# Anyway, I HIGHLY recommend you give Omniweb a try.  The only
# drawback is that
# it doesn't support some plugins.  So if you're on a site that
# uses the more
# obnoxious ones, you might load IE just for that site.

Subject: [sfraves] Subject: Re: [sfraves] where is nocturnal wonderland (Havasu?)


Fuckin A man, it's good to see another CRX fan on the list..  I love my CRX..
even tho some ass cut me off and it's now a somewhat wrecked CRX it's still a
pimp little car..  1 12 inch sub and I got mega bass(try that in your SUVs),
plus I don't hafto give everybody and their cousin a ride cause hey, it's a 2
seater!(not that I don't like giving friends rides, it's just that for a few
years I was THE party taxi and I got tired of it..)

So yeah, CRX fans unite! :)

I guess since I'm already posting I may as well include my review of
ascension..
To put it mildly, ascension ROCKED tonite!  I saw a bunch of old friends, met
more new ones(like always), and just generally had a great time..  The only
weird thing is I always thought Breeder would spin trance, being that almost
all of his remixes are trance, but no, it was some shake yo ass house, which
was a pleasant surprise actually.  Normally I have difficulty dancing to house
but his was so good it forced me to shake my ass on the dance floor!  I hella
didn't want to leave, but my ride was tired and has to work in the morning or
something, so oh well..

Is it just me, or are there more people OUTSIDE of ascension than inside now? 
I met like 6 people outside that were there all nite and didn't even go in at
all..  I guess if you just like to socialize that's coo, but personally I gotta
dance, that's the whole point of going to a party isn't it?

X-MSMail-priority: Normal

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: a new flavor of house; 'Zami'



 As most of you know, House grew out of the perpetual search for a
distinctive style demanded by Gay Dance clubs. Maybe it is because The gay
world was so cut off from the mainstream, it formed in the underground.
Maybe the atmosphere was more open to innovative styles. Whatever the
contributing factors were, many of these same contributing evolutionary
factors have spawned a whole different approach to House.
This different style is being born as we speak in the few and hard to find
Lesbian House parties. What forces this distinctive style to be different
than male gay house or straight house is the rhythms and musical styles that
the typical Lesbian dance club is rooted in. Hip Hop, Latin, classic disco,
and an appreciation of  lyric and melody from the stronger folk music roots
of lesbian entertainment.  These styles dominate Lesbian clubs to the point
of strangling their very attendance. But some women like house. Or should I
say some lesbian and dyke DJ's put their foot down and say enough is enough!
I will spin house. But the Lesbian/Dyke crowd is slow to give up old
standards and these very same DJ's must mix in old standards that the core
group can dance to.
Instead of this being a bad thing. At least one DJ does this with great
style. And it is this kind of energy and innovation (I feel) that keeps the
genre of house from becoming stale. Lesbian/Dyke House is a variety of
styles mixed together to elevate the dancer to a different plateau. It is
kind of neat to be around, see the different styles fuse and begin to go
somewhere. I think you will agree that this is a flavor full of female
energy.
DJ OlgaT is this DJ who has put down her foot and said "I will spin House".
And her club (ZAMI) tonight (Friday) is open to all people. Not just women.
It is held at the STUD at ninth and Harrison. Doors open at 10pm. OlgaT goes
on around 11pm. Let her know what you think.
If you do not respect women, whatever their individual choices are, please
do not waste your time here. It is not your scene.

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

what the flyer says, so ignore that doo dah)

Subject: [sfraves] [dfc] Mornin' drum roll...

Deepfog's Corner
Friday, August 24, 2001

------------------------
Mornin' Drum Roll
------------------------

I just wanted to share an incredible experience with all of you.

I went to a cool underground in Oakland on the night of August 18, 
2001, in a cool unused space that its only drawback is it is in the 
realm of the very chaotic neighborhood known infamously as the EBF 
House.  In that perimeter exists more cracked out shopping cart guys 
than anywhere in Oakland.  I don't care if you tell me that the 
Coliseum is the most unsafe neighborhood.  I agree with you...to a 
point.  I want you to understand that I lived in that neighborhood 
for long enough to know that it has a sort of evil, eerie entity that 
controls the riff-raff in that part of town.  And the riff-raff was 
certainly out in full force...shopping cart guys trying to knock down 
the fence that separated us...the neighbors 3 doors down throwing 
some kind of punk nurse nancy thing where they all got around to 
shoot bottle rockets all night...gee, personally, I can't think of a 
more meaningful way to spend my Saturday night...so they were 
shooting bottle rockets from midnight till 3 in the morning when we 
left and by that time they were shooting them directly at us!  I kid 
you not.

I ended up spinning at the afterparty they had down in San Jose. 
Fighting fatigue and slightly used equipment, I was not sure how long 
I was going to last...then at some point I got into an automatic 
groove and I literally did not know when, if ever, I was going to 
stop spinning records.  I was controlling the record players and the 
mixer...but it was no longer me mixing, but someone else.  I really 
felt like this was something that 'we' (all the minds in that room) 
participated in, and at that point I was no longer driving.  The 
turntables were driving themselves...has this ever happened to any of 
you?  I would love to hear about it.

...and I don't want anyone walking away from this email thinking this 
is me trying to tell everyone how good I am; there are plenty of 
folks be spinnin' out there in the rave world that got more practice 
than me, and that's why it was a rocky start, but then we got that 
'swishy' sound going for almost 3 hours...

I wanted to send my warmest hellos to the crew that made this little 
after party happen...David 'Dreamekore', the folks from Wevolve, and 
someone named Rene who jumped right out of the book I'm writing with 
those white contact lenses...if I got that all right.  Their group of 
people that enjoy the music enough to throw a free party for people 
that found out about it...it's people like you that make the scene 
fun for me.

Deepfog



---------------------------------------------------------------------

Cafés listing on www.metroactive.com.  Also, before the DJs spin serve some 
up, Waves cooks finger-licking BBQ lunch and dinner nightly M-F 
www.waves-smokehouse.com.  You can also catch a drink or a quick bite at 
Gordon Biersch and the Flying Pig Pub both right around the corner from 
Waves.

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Tech Support

All you tech geeks might appreciate this one. It's your friday 
pick-me-upper:)


Dear Tech Support:

Last year I upgraded from Boyfriend 5.0 to Husband 1.0 and noticed a
slow down in the performance of flower and jewelry applications that had
operated flawlessly under Boyfriend 5.0 In addition, Husband 1.0
uninstalled many other valuable programs, such as Romance 9.9, but installed 
undesirable programs such as NFL 5.0 and NBA 3.0. Conversation 8.0 no longer 
runs, and Housecleaning 2.6 simply crashes the system. I've tried running 
Nagging 5.3 to fix these problems, but to no avail. What can I do?

Desperate

***************************

Dear Desperate,

First keep in mind, Boyfriend 5.0 is an entertainment package, while
Husband 1.0 is an operating system. Try to enter the command:
C:/I THOUGHT YOU LOVED ME and install Tears 6.2. Husband 1.0 should then 
automatically run the applications: Guilty 3.0 and Flowers 7.0. But 
remember, overuse can cause Husband 1.0 to default to Grumpy Silence 2.5, 
Happy Hour 7.0, or Beer 6.1. Beer 6.1 is a very bad program that will create 
SnoringLoudly.WAV files. DO NOT install
Mother-In-Law 1.0 or reinstall another Boyfriend program. These are not
supported applications and will crash Husband 1.0. In summary, Husband 1.0 
is a great program, but it does have a limited memory and cannot learn new 
application quickly. You might consider buying additional software to 
improve performance. I personally recommend Hot Food 3.0, and Lingerie 6.9.

Good Luck,

Tech Support




"It is one of life's mysteries how an ounce of understanding, cleanses an 
ocean of mistrust and hate"
(The Outer Limits)

when they are

never

non-bitter people, and to find people who like to
dance who 
will dance with you there, and to see the beautiful
videos projected on the big screens, and to hear
wonderful

at Denny's with friends or new friends or just chat
with

the candy ravers parade into and fill the restaurant
with

important,

ever

suppose it might appear that way sometimes. i do have

Importance: Normal

Subject: [sfraves] My Thurs Night--Ascension and the Afterparty

Hey all!
        Well, it's 11:26am, and I have just got home from the afterparty for
Ascension, and I can tell u, it was an awesome nite =)  I was late to
Ascension as usual (about 11:30) but it was still awesome.  I went inside
just as that U2 remix was playin.  BTW does anyone know the name of the
artist and the track????  N E ways, I really got goin during Breeder's
breakbeat-ish set (despite hitting unfortunate members of the crowd who came
too near as I flailed my limbs about!).  I was also happy to bump into
Aaron, Osby, Jamie, Jeff, peeps from the AEC crew (who I hope to see again
tonite) and many other cool peeps!
	At about 1:30 I'd gotten rid of my fliers for the afterparty, and my friend
Evan and I gave a lift to three cool Brits who had been here three days to
the afterparty.  There, I finally got to meet DJ Teks, who spun an awesome
set of trance (am listening to his promo CD right now which is tiiiight).
As RecoveringDJ did his wicked deep house set, I was trying to decide what I
wanted to do with my set, but as he left the decks, I randomly decided I'd
pick out all my most housey stuff and just beatmatch into his set.
	I'd never really done a housey type of set in front of a crowd before, and
it was wierd for me spinning at 130 bpm (as opposed to my usual 138) and it
was totally unplanned, but it went pretty well!!  After that, Nad Is Dog
(Dan) did a sweet NRG set which ended with me and him spinning head to head
with some dark acid techno.
	Finally, at 7am, it was time to drive the Brits (who were awesome and
totally made the party) back to Berkeley, where they were staying, (and
where I got the biggest smoothie I have ever experienced for breakfast), and
then the drive back.  Now I'm here, relating it all to you and probably not
making much sense due to lack of sleep lol.

Well, thanks to all those who showed up for making it a cool party, and to
those who I missed, no worries!!  I'll probably see u all at AEC tonite
(which i believe is going to rock).  Also, if anyone who came wants to get
in contact with me, this is my email so write back!

Well, it's now 11:46pm, and I am going to go to my bed and hope i can make
it there before crashing.

Peace!

.:nomadic:.
www.nomadicDJ.com

<<<<{dance like no one's watching}>>>>

From: "His Highness" <the_emperor99@hotmail.com>
>All you tech geeks might appreciate this one. It's your friday
>pick-me-upper:)
>
>
>Dear Tech Support:
>
>Last year I upgraded from Boyfriend 5.0 to Husband 1.0 and noticed a
>slow down in the performance of flower and jewelry applications that had
>operated flawlessly under Boyfriend 5.0 In addition, Husband 1.0
>uninstalled many other valuable programs, such as Romance 9.9, but 
>installed
>undesirable programs such as NFL 5.0 and NBA 3.0. Conversation 8.0 no 
>longer
>runs, and Housecleaning 2.6 simply crashes the system. I've tried running
>Nagging 5.3 to fix these problems, but to no avail. What can I do?
>
>Desperate
>
>***************************
>
>Dear Desperate,
>
>First keep in mind, Boyfriend 5.0 is an entertainment package, while
>Husband 1.0 is an operating system. Try to enter the command:
>C:/I THOUGHT YOU LOVED ME and install Tears 6.2. Husband 1.0 should then
>automatically run the applications: Guilty 3.0 and Flowers 7.0. But
>remember, overuse can cause Husband 1.0 to default to Grumpy Silence 2.5,
>Happy Hour 7.0, or Beer 6.1. Beer 6.1 is a very bad program that will 
>create
>SnoringLoudly.WAV files. DO NOT install
>Mother-In-Law 1.0 or reinstall another Boyfriend program. These are not
>supported applications and will crash Husband 1.0. In summary, Husband 1.0
>is a great program, but it does have a limited memory and cannot learn new
>application quickly. You might consider buying additional software to
>improve performance. I personally recommend Hot Food 3.0, and Lingerie 6.9.
>
>Good Luck,
>
>Tech Support
>
>
>
>
>"It is one of life's mysteries how an ounce of understanding, cleanses an
>ocean of mistrust and hate"
>(The Outer Limits)

any body i am missing i know there is but hi anyways.

that is the hybrid 2 remix or at least that is what
Dave said it was.  You might want to ask him to
clarify.  But yeah that track totally made the night. 
Oh my god the crowd loved it.  
I never made it out to the afterparty i am so sorry
but when i finally got out of that Jack in the Box
dive through line it was like 3am, so I decided to
just go home and get some sleep.

see some of you tonight at the AEC party.
Muahz to all of ya
Jamie Star

>         Well, it's 11:26am, and I have just got home

> awesome.  I went inside
> just as that U2 remix was playin.  BTW does anyone
> know the name of the
> artist and the track????  N E ways, I really got
> goin during Breeder's
> breakbeat-ish set (despite hitting unfortunate
> members of the crowd who came
> too near as I flailed my limbs about!).  I was also
> happy to bump into
> Aaron, Osby, Jamie, Jeff, peeps from the AEC crew
> (who I hope to see again
> tonite) and many other cool peeps!
> 	At about 1:30 I'd gotten rid of my fliers for the
> afterparty, and my friend
> Evan and I gave a lift to three cool Brits who had
> been here three days to
> the afterparty.  There, I finally got to meet DJ
> Teks, who spun an awesome
> set of trance (am listening to his promo CD right
> now which is tiiiight).
> As RecoveringDJ did his wicked deep house set, I was
> trying to decide what I
> wanted to do with my set, but as he left the decks,
> I randomly decided I'd
> pick out all my most housey stuff and just beatmatch
> into his set.
> 	I'd never really done a housey type of set in front
> of a crowd before, and
> it was wierd for me spinning at 130 bpm (as opposed
> to my usual 138) and it
> was totally unplanned, but it went pretty well!! 
> After that, Nad Is Dog
> (Dan) did a sweet NRG set which ended with me and
> him spinning head to head
> with some dark acid techno.
> 	Finally, at 7am, it was time to drive the Brits
> (who were awesome and
> totally made the party) back to Berkeley, where they
> were staying, (and
> where I got the biggest smoothie I have ever
> experienced for breakfast), and
> then the drive back.  Now I'm here, relating it all
> to you and probably not
> making much sense due to lack of sleep lol.
> 
> Well, thanks to all those who showed up for making
> it a cool party, and to
> those who I missed, no worries!!  I'll probably see
> u all at AEC tonite

>> trying to decide what I
>> wanted to do with my set, but as he left the decks,

>> pick out all my most housey stuff and just beatmatch
>> into his set.
>> 	I'd never really done a housey type of set in front
>> of a crowd before, and
>> it was wierd for me spinning at 130 bpm (as opposed
>> to my usual 138) and it
>> was totally unplanned, but it went pretty well!! 
>> After that, Nad Is Dog
>> (Dan) did a sweet NRG set which ended with me and
>> him spinning head to head
>> with some dark acid techno.
>> 	Finally, at 7am, it was time to drive the Brits
>> (who were awesome and
>> totally made the party) back to Berkeley, where they
>> were staying, (and

>> experienced for breakfast), and

>> making much sense due to lack of sleep lol.

should hit me up when you got a problem, overheating is either thermostat, lack
of coolant(due to a line leak) or bad water pump..

Mine is as un-fixed up as it gets, it runs good, but looks like shit cause I'm
broke..

CRX's ride ok, little rough, but you get a really good feel for the road, so I
feel better doing crazy shit in it than I would in another type of car..
I actually got sideways a couple weeks ago for the first time ever in it, I
went into a turn WAY too fast and fishtailed it out, quite an accomplishment
for a front wheel drive that's super front heavy..

Subject: [sfraves] Sundance Grand Finale Picnic - BSP

The final in a series of wonderful summer events draws near.  Liquidcafe.com 
proudly presents:

               ::: SUNDANCE PARK PICNICS  :::
                   - the grand finale -
                 Sunday, September 30, 2001
                    Start time 10:00am

We have worked very hard to put together an extraordinary lineup of dj's to 
bring you 10 hours of blissful music.  This is the last park event for the 
year, and we have pulled out all the stops.  If you missed Sundance parts 1, 
and 2, then definitely make this your priority event of the summer so you 
won't be looking at the pictures online the next day, kicking yourself for 
not going. It has happened folks.
(view past sundance pics: http://www.liquidcafe.com/peeps2.html )


THE GRAND LINEUP

       ~``Forest of Fantasy ~``

Featuring:

DAVE STEIN (Baltimore, Maryland)
Yes folks, he's coming out to the West Coast just for this!

TELENE (Ear Candy, San Francisco)

- plus these exceptionally talented sonic manipulators -
JONATHAN GREATHOUSE (Insomniac/Bump Tribe, SF)
DRAGN'FLY (Epiphany/Teknique, Sac)
DJ PAT (Teknique, Fresno)
PAUL GORDON (Liquidcafe.com, Sac)
KELLEYGROOVE (U.S./S1/Stealth, Sac)
CONOR (Imagine Music, Sac)
TEEJAY (Dj Cafe, Sac)
SOLFUNK (sac)


   ~``Dunes of Delight ~``

Featuring:
BILLY LANE (Black-locust.com, Sacramento)

MEGATRON (Meshasoul/ASR, San Francisco)

- plus these highly skillful technicians -
SLIM & TOFU (UMS/Black-locust.com, Sac)
MIKEY J (Eklektic, Sac)
ROCKIT (Static Productions)
REASON (Black-locust.com)
ADRIA (Liquidcafe.com/Ascension, SF)
ETERNAL (YOU Productions, SJ)
CHRISTIAN BIRCKETT (Sac)

and toaster supreme
MC L-ski (Black-Locust, Sac)

Info: 916.466.9113  415.303.7404
Online: http://www.liquidcafe.com/events.html

Liquidcafe.com, the participating artists, and support crew, have all 
donated their time, talents and energy so as to give back to you the 
Electronic Dance Music community with gratitude for your constant support 
thru door and ticket purchases every weekend all year long.  This one's for 
you!!!


Admission: FREE, ZIP ZIPPO ZILCH!!


What to Bring:

Blankets
Folding chairs
water, and beverages
Food and BBQ stuff
sunscreen
little nieces and nephews, babies and family
Lots of smiles and happy faces

What not to Bring:

Drugs
Drug Paraphenalia
Binkies
Dust Masks
Bad Attitudes
crappy friends
Disorderly conduct
Anything that would give our scene a bad name.

Note: This will be a family event in a public park, carry yourselves
accordingly.

See ya soon.

Much love and gratitude for a great summer,

Paulie Paul
Liquidcafe.com


"It is one of life's mysteries how an ounce of understanding, cleanses an 
ocean of mistrust and hate"
(The Outer Limits)

Unfortunately, the Bicycle Time Machine encountered an ion storm on 
the way to Ascension and I got a flat.  I had to take a barge (BART) 
and walk it home.  Not fun when you have a flat.

I was thinking I was lucky I wasn't in like 17th Century France or 
something...I would have been stuck without a way to repair the tube. 
And did you know that bike tubes come with this green goopy stuff so 
you can tell where the hole is?

Anyway...so I took a ride this morning and I've already been to 
Ascension 2 weeks from now, and it was great.  I'll see you there. 
Look for a strange cloud...

id get 2 meet up w/ Mega like planned!!  He gave me a promo that I'll be li=
stening to on my ventures 2night!!  Yay!  Then I had to like stores to like=
 drop of fliers for the upsoming Orbit Sept 8th @ DNA lounge!!  (Jeno, Rich=
 SummerHayes & Melanie!)  So I go to Skills & Hello 2Day, Run into DJ Dos &=
 we talk!!  So proud of him!  Then across the way was Dragnfly & I haven't =
seen her in so long but talkin' 2 her makes it seem like we jus' spoke yest=
erday!!!  LoL!!  Love That Girl!  Oh yeah, Kicked it w/ Huey & Alias who we=
re workin'!  Yay!

     Then I went 2 Primal to drop of somemore fliers!!  The English Dude wh=
o works there remembered me so that was CooL!  We talked for a bit about Ho=
use Music. then I Cut & went 2 some other stores!  Then I humg out @ Blakes=
 & well, Josh, Josh & Penny showed up 4 dinner & I hung out w/ them!!  I wa=
s kicki' it w/ Audie, Ira, Beccam & Loryn B4hand, then I saw them!

     So LRD got on the decks & bust it on the Groovy House tip & coulda ssw=
orn I heard Breakbeats!  So that was sick!!  I was totally dancin!  It was =
Dope!!

     Then I went outside 2 like kick it & gosh, I didn't realize how long I=
 was out there!  But man, bumped into so many people!  The Coolest thing wa=
s seein' one of my Homeboys's who incidentally is the brother of one of my =
producers!!  So that was fun!!  But yeah, there were hella people outside! =
 Bumped in to Chris, Mikey, Dreg, Greg, Ryan, Becca, Veronica, Jenna, Oh ma=
n, Saw My Lil' Nic finally, Aaron (who I jumped up & hugged), Nat, Lydia, &=
 Kiki!  Oh yeah, bumped into Leslie while I was kickin' it outside & we cha=
tted for a few!

we started huggin'!  That was Jason (aka ekis4d on the list) & we were hell=
a happy to see each other finally!!  We also did hang out a majority of the=
 time during the night!  So that was fun!!=20=20

 It was Dope 'cause BRD ended the set w/ this total BreakBeats mix!  Oh oh =
oh, my homeboy Johnny from waaaaaay back in the day when him & I used 2 kic=
k it @ this pool hall in San Pablo was there & we totaly kicked it for a wh=
ile!!  But yeah, I was diggin' the Breakbeats!  So Dope!

     OH yeah, Breeader walks in w/ Jonathan Ojeda & I talked to like both o=
f them for a while!!  LoL  It was CooL!  Well anywaze, Breeder cam on next =
& Wow!!  Dope set!!  I did hear alota Breakbeats & it was on man!  So Dope!=

an, the Freshman, have invaded Cal!!  LoL  It was fun though!!  Kinda remem=
inded me of last year when the Frosh hit during the Sunday day shindig for =
ACME @ people park!  Hmmm

ion between Mikey & jaime & I totally misheard!!  Mikey was askin' about he=
r "kids" & how nice it was to see them on Sunday @ ASR!!  I thought Mikey s=

Are any fellow Berkeleyans or super-dope bay area peeps willing to help a group of fun-loving, super-chill Berkeley students? 

Here's how.

Four (car-less) girls and one guy need a ride to and from Berkeley to the venue of Still Bubblin' (since it's rumored to be, much to our disadvantage, about a 20 minute ride away from Berkeley!. Still bubblin' was supposed to be two of the girls first raves and all the tickets are already bought so it will be a shame if we had to cancel. =( The group is willing to be split up and chartered by different rides if needed. We are located at 2400 Durant Ave in the Unit 3 residence halls in Berkeley. If you interested in helping us and hanging out I'll e-mail you with my cell phone number, a description of the group, and directions. We are willing to go at whatever time is convient for you guys. 

Please be our hero! Save our day and be rewarded with kickass company. We'll be eternally grateful and love you forever!

-Lil'Beans

Subject: Re: [sfraves] ascension

Rowan Blades, more commonly known as Breeder, will
be playing Ascension this Thursday. It's going to sell out...
http://www.gatecrasher.co.uk/connected/djs/rowanblades/


R O W A N B L A D E S

Discography
Breeder - 'The Chain' / 'Clayface' (Rhythm Syndicate)
Breeder - 'Twilo Thunder' / 'Beetlejuice' (Rhythm Syndicate)
Breeder - 'Rockstone' (Rhythm Syndicate)
Breeder - 'Tyrantanic' (Rhythm Syndicate)
Breeder - 'New York FM' (Rhythm Syndicate)
Pariah 'Unnamed' (Rhythm Syndicate)

Remixes
Tilt - 'Children' (Deconstruction) Breeder mix
Grace - 'Not over Yet' (Code Blue) Breeder mix
Brother Brown - 'Under The Water' (FFRR) Breeder mix
Orbital - 'Nothing Left' (FFRR) Breeder mix
Orbital - 'Nothing Left' (FFRR) Pariah mix
Space Manoeuvres - 'Stage One' (Hooj Choons) Pariah mix
Evolution - Phoenix (Fluid UK) Breeder mix

R O W A N B L A D E S
Career Rowan Blades is best known as half of the massively successful
Breeder. Breeder's first two singles, 'The Chain' and 'Twilo Thunder', have
sold in excess of 25,000 copies world-wide, having first come to prominence
on Sasha's near-legendary 'Global Underground - San Francisco' compilation.
'Twilo Thunder' has since gone on to achieve great commercial success with
lucrative licences to compilations from the Ministry of Sound and Euphoria
2, which have sold over 500,000 copies between them. Breeder's third, fourth
and fifth tracks, 'Tyrantanic', 'Rockstone' and 'New York FM' have been
showcased on Sasha and John Digweed's last 'Northern Exposure - Expeditions'
compilation, as well as on John Digweed's 'Global Underground - Hong Kong'.
With over 20,000 pre-sales for Tyrantanic, things look set to continue in a
similar vain to how they have started, and in doing so stamping out any
doubt that they are a 'one hit wonder'. This rapid rise to prominence has
resulted in several high-profile remix projects. These include Tilt's
'Children', Planet Perfecto's classic 'It's Not Over Yet', Brother Brown's
'Under the Water', Orbital's 'Nothing Left', and Evolution's 'Phoenix'. On
the back of this success, Rowan has started a new project with Gaetan
Schurrer, who has engineered for Sasha. With successful remixes of,
Orbital's 'Nothing Left' (FFRR), and of Space Manoeuvres 'Stage One',
released on Hooj Choons, as featured on Sasha's recent Global Underground,
they seem to have established themselves without even releasing their first
single.

Breeder's success on Rowan's own Rhythm Syndicate record label has boosted
the label to a position of prominence within the dance music community.
Rowan has since been able to sign four new tracks to Rhythm Syndicate for
release next year, and has prospective mixes from the likes of Slacker, Tilt
& Evolution to name a few. Add to this the status of Rhythm Syndicate
Records as one of the top 10 independent dance music stores in the UK,
helping compile Pete Tong's Buzz Chart play-lists for Radio 1, and Rowan's
record empire is one of the most influential in the country.
Rowan's DJ-ing career has taken him all over the world. Having played in
Britain for gigs like Bedrock & Gatecrasher the success of Breeder has
enabled him to elevate himself onto an international stage. Breeder is
currently the biggest selling non-pop dance act in Norway, Rowan has played
there with great success, as well as in Sweden, and at a gig for 14,000
ravers in Copenhagen. The burgeoning American demand for dance music has
seen Rowan play at the legendary Shadow Lounge in Miami, as well as boat
parties on the Hudson. The nascent Chinese scene has seen Rowan playing at
The Face in Canton, attracting only 100 people less than Paul Oakenfold!
Most recently, Rowan taken his Rhythm Syndicate record label and the Breeder
name to Hong Kong as the main attraction of a huge gig for Clubstar
Entertainment's. He has also establish a monthly residency in Moscow for
Club Xlll. Closer to home, Rowan has a bi monthly with Union @ Space in
Leeds. He also still maintains his monthly residency with More Tea Vicar,
the Cambridge organisation for whom he has played with Sasha, Carl Cox and
Danny Howells, as well as the annual Strawberry Fayre festival, at which
Rowan played last year to 20,000 people.

Subject: [sfraves] HOUSE MUSIC 101:  Issue 26 - The Beginnings of Chicago House

--=====================_19999353==_.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

"The beat won't stop with the JM jock.  If he jacks the box and the 
partyrocks.  The clock tick tocks and the place gets hot.  So ease your 
mind and set yourself free.  To that mystifying music they call the key."

-JM Silk, "Music Is The Key," 1985.

"All of the records coming out of New York had been either mid or down 
tempo, and the kids in Chicago wouldn't do that all night long, they needed 
more energy..."

"When we first opened (the Warehouse) in '78, I was playing a lot of the 
East Coast records, the Philly stuff, Salsoul.  By '80/81, when that stuff 
(disco) was all over with, I started working a lot of the soul that was 
coming out.  I had to re-construct the records to work for my dancefloor,to 
keep the dancefloor happy, and there was no dance music coming out!  I'd 
take the existing songs, change the tempo, layer different bits of 
percussion over them, to make them more conducive for the dancefloor."

-Frankie Knuckles on the Chicago gay dance community, in the "Electronic 
Mail and Guardian" magazine.



XXVI.  THE BEGINNINGS OF CHICAGO HOUSE


A.  WHO "INVENTED" CHICAGO HOUSE?

There is lots of drama and passion in the house community around the issue 
of who actually created or invented the Chicago house genre.  Personally, I 
believe this is like asking:  "Who invented the blues, rock, or disco?"  No 
one person is generally responsible for the birth of an important 
genre.  New music arises from the hard work and innovation of many 
producers and DJs as well as a myriad of other factors like culture, place, 
technology, economic opportunity, specific musical influences and, indeed, 
serendipity.

One could probably write an entire book on the subject of who invented 
house.  There are many who actively claim the distinction.  Before we begin 
a more satisfying and detailed discussion of the evolution of Chicago house 
I thought I'd present some of the more interesting myths and facts relating 
to this invention dispute.

Frankie Knuckles played a very important role by bringing dance music and 
culture from New York to Chicago and laying the foundation for Chicago 
house.  To my knowledge, however, he has never said he "invented" the genre.

Leonard Remix RRoy asserts that he gave birth to house on May 5, 1981.

LRRoy seems to have had a difficult, emotionally challenged life.  He gave 
up spinning after his mother died in 1985, joined the army to deal with his 
grief, and has recently, I understand, got behind the turntables again.

LRRoy was, by all accounts, a remarkable and much respected DJ.  He spun at 
the Rink Zone in the early eighties and won a legendary battle against 
Steve "Silk" Hurley at Sauers where Hurley was resident DJ.  The 
participants were Eric "ET" Taylor, Keith Fobbs,  Steve Hurley and 
LRRoy.  Hurley mixed a record backwards in that battle and played a 
prerelease copy of Jamie Principle's "Your Love."  Then LRRoy came on 
leading with "Big Bee" and totally rocked the crowd and the judges.  He 
walked away with the $500 prize.  It is said that Farley "Jackmaster" Funk 
refused to participate in the battle because he was fearful of losing to LRRoy.

Leonard claims he invented the term "house music" in the spring of '81.  He 
says he was mixing "Chance With You" by Brother to Brother at his home when 
his mother suggested he mix some of the other old music in the basement of 
their house.  Leonard did some edits on some old stuff like "Cathedrals" by 
D.C. LaRue and put the music in his mix.  When Lowell Tuff of the club 
Bitter End asked him what he was spinning, he replied:  "House music."

Then Chip E. is quoted as saying he created house music in March of 
1985;  and Farley "Jackmaster" Funk is alleged by some to have written and 
produced "Love Can't Turn Around," one of the biggest selling "House" 
records and he, therefore, invented house.  One could go on.

My sympathies in this house family drama have always been with Jesse 
Saunders.  Even before he began his one-man campaign in the late nineties 
to reestablish his role in the development of house, it was clear to 
everyone in the music and dance community that the first house recordings 
were issued by Saunders Jes Say label.

Further, there is general agreement that the first house music on wax was 
released in 1984.  That record was "On and On," written and produced by 
Jesse on his new label.  Next was Z Factor's "Fantasy"  produced by Jesse 
but released on another label.  The big house "cross-over" hit, "Love Can't 
Turn Around," was actually written, produced and arranged by Jesse.  He 
sang background on it as well, with Farley.  Jesse was in litigation over 
the copyright to this song and finally won in court all rights to "Love" 
from MCA Records.  Finally, Trax Records did not own the Jes Say 
catalog.  All music published by Jesse now belongs, I understand, to his 
current company Just Say Productions.

Jesse fought a long and hard battle to achieve the recognition he 
deserves.  His music has been stolen, copyrights have been infringed, and 
he has been the victim of much negative drama.

Jesse sees himself as the "originator" of house music.  By "originator" he 
means that he "...started and/or fused a sound with a lot of different 
ingredients, but was derived with the help of other influences (time, 
place, people, etc.)."  He does not claim to have invented or created the 
genre and admits that house would not exist without the likes of Frankie 
Knuckles, Vince Lawrence, Farley "Jackmaster" Flash and the Hot Mix 5 as 
well as the  promoters and labels that facilitated the distribution of 
early house.  House music, therefore, evolved as a collaborative 
effort.  Jesse sort of put the ingredients together.

Jesse also credits Frankie Knuckles' Warehouse as the venue where the term 
"house" originated.  The energizing music Frankie played came to be called 
"house," and was eventually applied to the genre.

On July 17th, 1997, the City of Chicago recognized his efforts by 
proclaiming a "Jesse Saunders and the Pioneers of House Music" day.

Fine.  I think most people can accept this reasonable interpretation of 
events.  I can live with it.  We will look at Jesse Saunders' creative and 
interesting house career in more detail later.



B.  AFRICAN AMERICANS CREATED HOUSE MUSIC

Like virtually every important American musical creation, house music was 
created in and by the African American community.

Further, house music evolved in a subset of that community:  the gay dance 
underground -- just as disco and garage in NYC blossomed forth from the 
black gay community.

Chicago house emerged from the ruins of disco, but with a flavor and 
texture that is uniquely Chicago.  For Chicago itself has a rich and varied 
musical culture that includes important innovations in jazz, blues and soul 
music.  Chicago was not a musical wasteland by any means when Frankie 
Knuckles moved from NYC to take up residency at the Warehouse.  Rather, the 
existing musical culture and the resulting needs of his Warehouse dancers 
shaped the music he brought from the East coast, and not visa-versa.

In the next issue we will briefly look at some of Chicago's modern music 
culture and its influence on the creation of house music.


NEXT:  CHICAGO JAZZ, BLUES AND SOUL

Love,

Apollo










"It is only with the heart that one can see rightly;  what is essential is 
invisible to the eye."
-Antoine de Saint-Exupery

"I'm astounded by people who want to "know" the universe when it's hard 
enough to find your way around Chinatown."
-Woody Allen

CAT CLUB, 1190 FOLSOM STREET, SF
$10 // 21+ Must have ID // 10pm-3am

**You can purchase discount tickets for KLUTE at the ANDY C. show the 
night before**

consistent as possible.

Subject: [sfraves] AEC Rocked! (kind a long)

Oh my gosh wow.  It's 11:36am and I just got home. 
And i couldn't stop smiling all the way.  It was one
of those night that you truly love being a raver. 
O.k.
So a friend of mine is visiting from Louisiana and
staying in Sac.  So Last night I went to go grab him
to go to the AEC party, Half way there I get calls
from my other friends that where suppose to come with
me last night and they tell me they are not up to it
anymore.  Well I went to get Brian from Sac. and on
the way down to the first map point we look at some of
his pictures of parties he's gone to and some that
he's thrown.  It's so cute he has this one pic of
Thomas Trouble at one of the parties he's thrown here
in the bay area with his infamous cigarette hang out
the side of his mouth. And he still has the ticket
from a party he went to here that says "Oakland
International Rave Center"  Thought that was cute. wow
so many pics and stuff it was great.
So map point to map point and we are off to the party.
Wow what a great spot. We waited for a bit for the
party to actually begin and wondered down to the
location.  
Is that jungle I hear?  Is that a girl at the decks? 
Is that AMBER spinning jungle?  Oh wow, i couldn't
believe it.  But yeah what a nice way to start the
night. DK came on with an NRG set.  Andy W played some
funky BOOTY HOUSE, haha got to love that guy.  IRA was
that trance i heard you doing?  And Michal aka the red
stick man did house, oh and yeah i did actually like
the Hall and Oats track thank you.
Chilled with Amber for a bit and i have to say she is
such an awesome chick. Such a wonderful persona, so
down to earth ya know.  Hehe was great chilling with
Andy W again.  Osby came out totally goth.  He was so
into character it scared me.  I was like Nooooo!!!
Where is osby and what did you do to him (good bye
tomorrow).  O.k. so my alter ego was a Kandy Kid (that
lasted fifteen minutes) and I had this interactive
teletubby (yes that was mine), Chris could not put it
down almost all night, I know it got passed around a
few times. Oh but then Chris gets up on the bulldozer
to dance.  Then i gaze in the distance and I am like
What the fuck is that.  Yes Yes Yes Michael brought
out his Red Stick Man Outfit.  What a fucken trip. I
was loven it.  That made the party. 
And such a nice turn out too I would have to say about
150 ppl there at it's peak.  Not bad for a party like
this one.
Hi to all I saw last night, Laith and roommate, Erika
aka kikigirl, Becca, Veronica, Ryan, Ira, Michael,
Andy W, Eric, Audra, Shannon, Ericka, Chris, Marianna,
Amber, Jim, Dave and Osby of course.
So About 7:30 we all start to head out, and I head for
Sac. to take Brian home.  Thank you guys for being so
hospitable to him, and showing him how we like to
party in the bay area. Brian have fun with dragn'fly
tonight at Smile. And safe journey home.
Every ones little Star
Jamie Star

Oh One last thing........
Alter Ego Crew fucken Rocks.  Thank you guys for such
an amazing night.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: IE OR NETSCAPRE 6.0

Hells yeah I agree 100% with Genone.. FUCK NETSCAPE...

Netscape is a thorn in my ass -- and you could
probably argue that I.E. promotes bad coding, since it
allows for you to make any number of mistakes and
still display the page properly, while Netscape is
most unforgiving.. 

BUT.  Netscape also has a number of weird-ass issues
concerning display and I waste more time trying to
iron out Netscape's quirky bugs when I could be coding
more pages..

Anyway, like Genome said, they are dropping out of the
browser market.. so hopefully won't have to deal with
it too much in the future.  And that's not to say that
I am supporting I.E. 100% either.. Microsoft sux too..
like i said before.. Opera is a kick ass
browser..(www.opera.com)

--kimba

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: IE OR NETSCAPRE 6.0

[Sir Dapy Of Dorkdom <dapydork@yahoo.com>]
> 
> People tend to give Microsoft a bad rap when in reality Windows 3.11 was
> stable considering what it really was, which is a first version.  Sure you
> will see people claiming to have copies of Windows 1 and 2, but in reality
> they were developer previews and internal test applications and not really
> for everyday use.  So for being a first version it was pretty stable and I
> think most of the problems that people had with it were related to
> configuration, driver issues and the fact that people just did not take the
> time or effort to learn to configure and tweak the system properly.  Those
> who did will tell you the same thing I am telling you.  As for Windows 95,
> it added more features and was very stable, even more stable then Windows
> 3.11 the only problem is that people who had older hardware and unstable
> Windows 3.11 setups wanted the upgrade to work miracles and fix all of their
> problems and it didn't.  It wasn't designed to do that.  Windows 95b was
> actually even more stable then Windows 95 or even 95a because it did not
> support upgrades and had more drivers.  Windows 98 built upon the stability
> of Windows 95, but added the integration of Windows and Internet Explorer
> and there were problems with the upgrade so once again the uninformed blamed
> the OS, not their hardware or setup.  Windows 98 Second Edition fixed a lot
> of the stability problems with the IE 4 / Win Explorer merger and led way to
> Windows ME which was basically created for the machine manufacturers so that
> they could have better rollout tools and an easier way to add all of the
> security and service pack and hot fix updates released by Microsoft over the
> year since the release of Windows 98.  It also started using a new driver
> model closer to that of Windows NT/2K.

This is a totally ridiculous paragraph.  I'm sorry, I don't even believe
that this is the forum to have this discussion, but I can't let something
this incorrect pass for the truth around here.

Windows is not stable.  Period. End of sentence.  It hasn't been until
recently that Microsoft has even thought of it as any kind of priority to
deal with any kind of stability issues in their operating systems or even
their applications.

When people like myself talk about stability, we're not talking hours or
days.  We're not talking weeks.  We're talking months, at the least.
What's the longest you've had a Windows box of any flavor go 60 days
without needing to be rebooted?  NT and 2K may approach this kind of
stability, but the 9x/Me series could not go a month without crashing.

You want to talk real stability?  A real OS will be stable enough,
pay close attention here, that a machine running it will stay up
through an entire Microsoft product cycle.  I know of machines in people's
bedrooms that have run for two years or more without a reboot.

In my experience with these pieces of software, I've learned a thing or
two.  I know more about Windows than most people who support it, and I know
about Unix than most people who support (Ah! The joys of being an
engineer!).  

Do you know that in Canada, the highest tax bracket of their tax systems
starts pretty low, probably around $75,000/year?  Do know that their
highest tax bracket is 51%?  That's right, more than half of your income
goes to the government as tax.  That's a about a third more than,
percentage-wise than you would pay in the United States.

What's my point?  Saying that Windows is stable is like saying that
Canadians don't have high taxes: it's nuts.  In a world where all
definitions like this are relative, stable is not the way to describe
Windows.  You clearly either a) have no experience running a truly stable
operating system or b) have some other agenda that's making you lie.

/ari, still recovering from the very fucking cool Urban Wasteland last
night.

-- 
Ari							there is no spoon

Subject: [sfraves] Rave Rage

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Rave Rage

By Jacob Sullum

Despite all the pot and LSD consumed at their concerts, no one ever tried 
to ban the Grateful Dead. But that's what the city of Chicago would like to 
do to raves, those all-night dance parties featuring electronic music, 
flashing lights, and silly hats.

The Chicago Tribune anxiously describes raves as "one-night-only 
parties...often held in warehouses or secret locations where people pay to 
dance, do drugs, play loud music, and engage in random sex acts." Taking a 
dim view of such goings-on, the Chicago City Council recently approved an 
ordinance that threatens building owners and managers who knowingly allow 
raves on their property with jail terms of up to six months. "They are 
after all our children," Mayor Richard Daley declared. "Parents should be 
outraged."

State legislators agree. The Illinois House of Representatives is 
considering a bill that would make it a crime to promote a rave where 
illegal activity takes place. According to the Tribune, the bill's 
supporters are "fine-tuning" their definition of a "criminal rave" so the 
legislation can "withstand a court challenge."
In New Orleans, meanwhile, the U.S. government is prosecuting a rave 
promoter and a concert hall manager under a federal law aimed at shutting 
down crack houses. Facing up to 20 years in prison if convicted, the 
defendants argue that the prosecution is a form of censorship.

"Holding club owners and promoters of raves criminally liable for what some 
people may do at these events is no different from arresting the stadium 
owners and promoters of a Rolling Stones concert or a rap show because some 
concert goers may be smoking or selling marijuana," says Graham Boyd, 
director of the American Civil Liberties Union's Drug Policy Litigation 
Project. "If the government is successful in shutting down raves, what's to 
stop them from applying this tactic to other music genres...where drug use 
is known to exist?"

Mayor Daley is reportedly fond of jazz. Fortunately, that genre has never 
been associated with drugs.


http://www.reason.com/0108/ci.js.rave.html


"It is only with the heart that one can see rightly;  what is essential is 
invisible to the eye."
-Antoine de Saint-Exupery

"I'm astounded by people who want to "know" the universe when it's hard 
enough to find your way around Chinatown."
-Woody Allen


--=====================_556335==_.ALT--

ing again!!  But ya know, wearing all that gothie stuff was fun!  Hmmmm

=3D=3D
Later {8O)
Pe@ce-->Just Me-->O=A7BY

From sfraves-return-71883-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Sun Aug 26 01:09:55 2001
